definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: In two referendums, they supported the bridge plan.
sentences.chinese: 在两次公民投票中，人们都支持建桥计划。

sentences.english: Meech Lake … Institutions, Behaviour and Public Policy Ontario. …
sentences.chinese: 论加拿大公民投票制度与运作。

sentences.english: He pointed out that they would require referendums in at least four countries.
sentences.chinese: 他指出，他将在至少四个国家要求公民投票。

sentences.english: The Cabinet plans to hold a national referendum on the political crisis.
sentences.chinese: 泰国内阁计划就这场政治危机举行公民投票。

sentences.english: Then there would be a plebiscite.
sentences.chinese: 那么就会举行公民投票。

sentences.english: Yet the referendum is not in the bag.
sentences.chinese: 现在还很难说公民投票已经是囊中之物。

sentences.english: In the referendum voters approved the new constitution the generals want to foist on them.
sentences.chinese: 在公民投票中，选民认可了将军强加于他们的新宪法。

definition: referendum/abbr. for 公民投票[gong1 min2 tou2 piao4]
public decision (by ballot)/majority decision/a joint decision/referendum
lower chamber (of legislative body)/lower house/the House of Commons
